bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. John Dugan. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:

July 2 Complaint files
13679 Mr. Hurt
No. 1992
plaintiff vs.
defendant
Clerk's office 8 1887 Recieved of the Clerk of the District Court Complaint in this case, and Attorney Let have the papers in this case Judge
Territory of Washington County of Spokane
In the District Court of the Territory of Washington for the Judicial District thereof holding unclear as Spokane Falls County of Spokane in said Territory In the matter of the application of John Dugan for writ of Habeas Corpus
The petition of Dugan respectfully shows That he the said John unclear unlawfully imprisoned,detained,confined, and restrained of his liberty by James Glispins Sherff of Spokane County of the County jail in unclear in said County That the said imprisonment detention confinement and restraint are illegal and that the illegality thereof consists in this to wit: to said in the 1st day of June 1887 your petitioner was committed to jail in default of giving $1500 bail as required by . Pierce a Justice of the Peace is and for Spokane County W. P to to the change of being accessory to the of murder when one Fraud seller in said County on the 3 day of May 1887: That upon the haurination of your petitioner before said: Pierce, Justice of the Peace, there was not produced any evidence in any manner to infolicate this petitioner in said murder nor anything lending to show him guilty of the crime charged nor being accessory there ; but nevertheless the said Justice unlawfully held him to bail as foresaid and he is and said has been unlawfully imprisoned and restrained of his liberty said James Glispins Sheriff by reason of the as foresaid Petitioner further states that as or about the 11th day of June 1887 one John J. Bous a Justice of the Peace in and for the County of Spokane W. held the petitioner witness in the case in the Territory of Washington as many Teller and required petitioner to finish bail in the sum of $1000.100 as said witness That in default thereof he was committed to the custody of James unclear Sheriff of foresaid who is said unlawfully imprisoned him and restrained him of his liberty because said amount of bail is subordinate and Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be parted directly to said James Glispins Sheriff a foresaid commanding him to have the body of your petitioner before before your Honor or a time and place therein to be specified to do and revive what shall therebe condemned by your Honor concerning your petitioner together with the said and cause of the detention and this writ; and that your petitioner be restored of his liberty John Dugan by Turner Fortes His ally
Territory of Washington County of Spokane George M Fortes first duty sworn on oath states that he is the attorney of the petitioner John Dugan and makes this affardivit his behalf: that he has read the foregoing petitioner for Habeas Corpus. unclear the contents thereof and believes the cause to be George M Fortes unclear and sworn to before this 11th day of June 1887.
Notary Public Washington Territory
To the Clerk offfice District Court
as ceased in the petitioner before we at chambered in Spokane Halls W. at 10 oclock and July 2d 1887. dated Spokane Falls P.T June 30, 1887 George Turner Judge
Territory of Washington Before Hon County of Spokane District Judge Peel: Court Fourth Judicial Did:
In the matter of the application of John Dugan for a writ of Habeas Corpus
His hereby stipulated by and be- tween the Territory of Washington and John Dugan that the above application shall be before the Hon. Geo. Turner Judge upon the testimony given in the case of the Territory of Washing- ton Many Tellers in an exam- ination John S Borge by on the 8th and 9th day of June 1887 as returned by said Justice and reported by a a stew in attendance thereof the and had alot of hilits and cause dates July 2nd 1887
ally for petitioner
prosecuting ally
In the matter of the application John Dugan for a writ of Habeas Corpus
on reasoning
Sheriff
Returning the written stipendation to clerk 1.00 milage 2 miles 20 1.20
Territory of Washington County of Spokane In the district Court of the Fourth Judicial District of said Territory, holding terms of Spokane Falls in said county and Territory.
In the matter of the application of John Dugan for writ of Habeas Corpus
To Sheriff of Spokane County; Greeting:
on the 10th day of June of 1887 and John Dugan was committed by J. Borge a Eng. a Justice of the Peace in and for said county of Spokane, upon a writ of commitment issued by said Justice of the Peace and directed to said Sheriff committing said John Dugan on failure to give said bail for his appearance at the next regular term of the District Court and give this Testimony in a certain cause therein spending wherein The Territory of Washington in plaintiff and many E. Teller is defendant, and imprisoned by you in pursuance of such writ of commitment on failure of said John Dugan to give bail in the sum of $1000.00. Now, therefore in the of the United States you are commanded that you produce the body of the said John Dugan, by whatever he is held by you, before the Hon. George Turner associate Justice of the Sumpreme Court of Washington Territory and Judge of said Court at his chambers in the city of Spokane Falls at ten o'clock on the 2nd day of July of 1887. Herein fail not, and have you there and there this writ your thereon. Witness the Hon. George Turner Judge of said Court and the seal thereof affixed this 1st day of July of 1887 D.A Clement Clerk
Territory of Washington County of Spokane James unclear Sheriff of Spokane County hereby certify that I have the within writ there within Defendant John Dugan have him in court. James unclear Sheriff Spokane County W.T. By AL Duncan
In the matter of the application of John Dugan for a writ of Habeas Corpus
This cause coming a for before me this 2d day of July 1887 on the of the of Habeas Corpus, il was wherein the Pierce and for the Turner and the Court the evidence taken before the committing in the case of the Territory vs. more Teller as the evidence against the petitioner and the court being heard said testimony and declined to a a council, is appears to the court that there to vaccine the petitioner's fully the crime with which , charged, said petitioner he discharged from under the commitment issued by F.W Pierce, Justice of the Peace, nothing the said petitioner a to the murder of Frank Teller, and in further approving to the court that said petitioner in under a further commitment issued by J. Boog, Justice of the Peace as in the , The Territory is more Teller, is defined a bail with in a one , and is approving to the court that said bail in in said bail in in the form of two hundred and fifty-dollars and that when said petitioner shall give and with to the with Sheriff to appear as a witness in said court at the county court and from bail to until July and then that the said petitioner be destroyed from custody and permitted as this 2nd day of July 1887 George Turner Judge
